analyzed: gal te skye ba med par gang gi gnas par 'gyur na de'i tshe mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa rnams kyang gnas par @144a * //

analyzed: 'gyur ro // rtsod pa po las brjod par bya ste /

analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa yang ma yin te de bas na skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa rnams rim gyis 'byung ba ma yin no //

original: 'di ltar skye ba'i dus na 'jig pa dang gnas pa med la /
analyzed: 'di ltar skye ba'i dus na 'jig pa dang gnas pa med la /

analyzed: 'jig pa'i dus na yang skye ba dang gnas pa med cing /

analyzed: gnas pa'i dus na yang skye ba dang 'jig pa dag med pa de bas cig tsor 'byung ba ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And at the time of enduring, there is no arising and no ceasing. Therefore, they do not occur simultaneously.

original: dus gcig pa yin na skye ba dang 'chi bdag gcig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: dus gcig pa yin na skye ba dang 'chi bdag gcig tu 'gyur te /

original: 'di ni 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: But this is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag rim dang cig car du 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag rim dang cig car du 'byung ba med do //

analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum yin pa de lta na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: de la gzhan dang gzhan yin pas thams cad dus gsum nyid 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de bzhin du gnas pa dang 'jig pa dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //

original: thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba yang 'thob ste /
analyzed: thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba yang 'thob ste /

analyzed: de rnams kyang gzhan dang / gzhan gyi nus pas skye ba dang / gnas pa dang 'jig par thal bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de bas na skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa rnams la re re la gsum gsum du 'gyur ro //

original: de lta ma yin na 'dus byas ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'dus byas ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de las ma gtogs pa gzhan 'dus byas nyid ni yod pa ma yin te /

analyzed: de'i phyir 'dus byas mtshan nyid gsum pa'o zhes gang brjod pa 'di dam bca' ba nyams par thal bar 'gyur te /

original: de bas na 'dus byas ni med do //
analyzed: de bas na 'dus byas ni med do //

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /

analyzed: 'dus byas bkag pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas khas blangs la /

analyzed: de khas blangs pa'i phyir 'dus byas 'grub ste /

original: thams cad ni zla yod par dmigs te /
analyzed: thams cad ni zla yod par dmigs te /

analyzed: ji ltar sdug bsngal dang / bde ba dang / chos dang / chos ma yin pa dang / grang ba dang dro ba bzhin te /

analyzed: de bzhin du 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyang yin par bya ste /

analyzed: de bas na 'dus ma @144b byas grub pa'i phyir gnyi ga grub po //
translated: Therefore, because the unconditioned is established, both are established.

analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang thams cad du 'gro ba dang / rtag pa dang / phyogs dang bral ba rnams so zhe na /
translated: But the unconditioned is omnipresent, permanent, and devoid of spatial division.

original: smras pa / phyogs gcig tsam mo //
analyzed: smras pa / phyogs gcig tsam mo //

translated: Here, if the self, the subtle particle, space, time, direction, etc. are all-pervading, then this should be asked: Does this self of yours abide in the body in one part or does it abide in the body in all parts? If it abides in one part,

analyzed: de'i tshe phyogs gcig pas rnam par gnas pa'i phyir phyogs gcig pa gzhan rnams kyis kyang 'gyur bar bya dgos so //

analyzed: phyogs dang bcas pa'i phyir yang mi rtag pa nyid de ltar gang phyogs su 'jug pa de dag ni mi rtag pa ste /

original: dper na bum pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bum pa la sogs pa lta bu'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad bkag pas thams cad du 'gro ba dang / rdul phra rab la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag rtag pa dang / thams cad du 'gro ba dang / phyogs dang bral ba rnams phyogs gcig dang bcas pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: In the same way, if the permanent, omnipresent particles and so on are refuted, then they would have parts, because they are omnipresent and partless.

translated: And because the body has parts, it would follow that the particles and so on also have parts.üîΩMoreover, are permanent things established from a cause?

original: rgyu med pa las 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las 'grub par 'gyur /

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /

original: gnyi ga la yang skyon yod de /
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang skyon yod de /

analyzed: gal te rgyu las yin na de'i tshe mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: de lta na yang nges pa med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te /

original: dngos po med pa nyid du yang thal bar yang 'grub ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa nyid du yang thal bar yang 'grub ste /

analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like the son of a barren woman, etc.

original: ci ste khyed cag gi tshig tsam gyis grub kyi bdag gis ni ma yin no /
analyzed: ci ste khyed cag gi tshig tsam gyis grub kyi bdag gis ni ma yin no /
translated: If you say that it is established by your mere words and not by our words,

analyzed: 'dir bye brag gis gtan tshigs brjod dgos so //
translated: then you must state a reason with an example.

original: ci ste rgyu ni rnams pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ci ste rgyu ni rnams pa gnyis te /
translated: If you say that there are two kinds of causes,

original: med pa dang / gsal ba'o //
analyzed: med pa dang / gsal ba'o //
translated: nonexistent and existent,

original: de la gang @145a * //
analyzed: de la gang @145a * //
translated: then we reply that

original: dag byed pa'i rgyus skyed pa de dag ni rtag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dag byed pa'i rgyus skyed pa de dag ni rtag pa ma yin te /
translated: those things that are produced by a productive cause are not permanent,

original: ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like a pot, etc.

analyzed: gang gi gnas bzhin pa de dag nyid kyis mngon par gsal bar byed kyi skyed pa ma yin pa de ni gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu ste /

analyzed: ji ltar sgron ma dang nor bu la sogs pa'i 'od lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the light of a lamp or a gem.

analyzed: de la byed pa'i rgyus ni mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: The cause of manifestation is impermanent,

analyzed: chos mi mthun pa ni gang dag mi skye ba rgyus mngon par gsal ba 'ba' zhig pa de dag ni rtag pa'o //

original: de lta na ni 'o na byas pa yod pa nyid du mthong bas /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na byas pa yod pa nyid du mthong bas /

analyzed: chos mi mthun pas byas pa rnams med pa nyid du 'gyur bas rtag pa rnams don med do //

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /

analyzed: rtsva la sogs pa rnams kyis grub pa nyid kyi phyir ro // de'i phyir na 'bras bu yod pa ma yin zhing 'bras bu med pa ma yin la /
translated: Nor is it causeless, because it is established by grass, etc.üîΩTherefore, the effect does not exist and the effect does not not exist.

original: 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa yang ma yin la /
translated: The effect is not existent and nonexistent.

original: rgyu med pa yang ma yin no ;üîΩ/'dir smras pa /
analyzed: rgyu med pa yang ma yin no ; /'dir smras pa /
translated: Nor are they causeless.
